meanings.sent1: He wanted to masculinise his appearance by growing a beard.
meanings.sent2: The father tried to masculinise the nursery by adding blue accents.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a cat trying to masculinise itself by wearing a tiny tie made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to masculinise the sky, darkening it with their presence.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape billowed behind him, adding a masculinising touch to his already imposing figure.

meanings.definition: To give a masculine quality or character to.
meanings.sent1: She hoped the new haircut would masculinise her look and boost her confidence.
meanings.sent2: The cologne he wore seemed to masculinise his aura, making him more attractive.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried to masculinise his toy tea set by pretending it was a toolbox.
meanings.sent4: The rugged mountains seemed to masculinise the landscape, giving it a sense of strength.
meanings.sent5: The deep voice of the narrator masculinised the story, adding a powerful tone to the tale.
